Class PlayerProjectileFactory

java.lang.Object
sk.stuba.fiit.factories.projectilefactories.ProjectileFactory
sk.stuba.fiit.factories.projectilefactories.PlayerProjectileFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Factory<Projectile>
public class PlayerProjectileFactory extends ProjectileFactory
Factory class for creating player-specific projectiles. The PlayerProjectileFactory extends the ProjectileFactory and is responsible for creating projectiles with properties specific to the player, based on the projectile template and the attacker's position and radius.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerProjectileFactory

      public PlayerProjectileFactory(Projectile projectileTemplate, float radiusOfAttacker, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 positionOfAttacker)
      Constructs a new PlayerProjectileFactory with the given projectile template, attacker's radius, and position.
      Parameters:
      projectileTemplate - The template projectile to use for creating new player projectiles.
      radiusOfAttacker - The radius of the player that fires the projectile.
      positionOfAttacker - The position of the player that fires the projectile.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public Projectile create(Object... direction)
      Creates a new player projectile by invoking the parent class's `create` method. The projectile is customized with the direction vector and other properties defined in the parent class.
      Specified by:
      create in interface Factory<Projectile>
      Overrides:
      create in class ProjectileFactory
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction in which the player projectile will move (as a Vector2).
      Returns:
      A new player projectile instance with the specified properties.
